skill.name: Global Conventions
skill.description: Follow project-wide development conventions including project structure, version control practices, environment configuration, documentation, dependency management, and code review processes. Use this skill when organizing files/directories, writing commit messages, managing branches, configuring environments, handling secrets, maintaining documentation, or establishing team workflows. Apply when working with project structure, README files, .gitignore, environment variables, dependency files (package.json, requirements.txt), feature flags, changelogs, or any aspect of project organization and team collaboration that requires consistency across the development lifecycle.
skill.summary: Follow project-wide development conventions including project structure, version control practices, ...
skill.author: EIS-ITS

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation guidelines. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access beyond its own directory, or environment variable access. The skill provides development conventions for Claude Code to follow.

content.value_statement: Development teams struggle with inconsistent code practices across contributors. This skill provides Claude with standardized guidelines for project structure, version control, documentation, and team workflows.
actual_capabilities: Enforces consistent project structure and file organization
Guides commit message creation and branch management
Manages environment configuration and secrets handling
Maintains documentation standards for README and changelogs
Oversees dependency management and feature flag usage
Establishes code review processes and contribution guidelines
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files automatically
Requires external documentation file for detailed rules
Provides guidance only - actual enforcement depends on user implementation
Cannot validate external project configurations or third-party systems

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Workflows
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members follow the same conventions for commits, branches, and code reviews

use_cases.title: Maintain Documentation Standards
use_cases.description: Keep README files, changelogs, and contribution guides consistent across releases

use_cases.title: Onboard with Best Practices
use_cases.description: Guide new developers through project structure, environment setup, and dependency management

prompt_templates.title: Set Up Project Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me organize the files for this new feature following our project conventions. What directory structure should I use?

prompt_templates.title: Write Commit Message
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my changes and suggest a proper commit message format following our conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Update Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: How should I update the README file to document this new feature? What sections need changes?

prompt_templates.title: Review Code Process
prompt_templates.prompt: What requirements must be met before merging this code? Check against our code review standards.

output_examples.input: How should I structure the new authentication module?
output: Follow the project conventions for module structure:
- Create separate files for models, controllers, and utilities
- Add entry in `README.md` with usage examples
- Create a feature flag for gradual rollout

best_practices: Define conventions early and document them in a single source of truth
Review all pull requests against established standards
Update conventions proactively when project needs evolve
anti_patterns: Skipping documentation updates when adding new features
Using inconsistent commit message formats across contributors
Storing secrets in environment files without proper encryption

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidelines that any AI assistant can follow.

faq.question: What conventions does this skill cover?
faq.answer: It covers project structure, version control, environment config, documentation, dependency management, and code review.

faq.question: How do I customize conventions for my project?
faq.answer: Update the referenced conventions markdown file with your project-specific rules. The skill will automatically use them.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads its own configuration files. It does not access external systems or transmit data.

faq.question: Why are my conventions not being applied?
faq.answer: Ensure the conventions file exists at the expected path and that it is properly formatted with clear guidelines.

faq.question: How is this different from linters and formatters?
faq.answer: This skill provides high-level guidance and context. Linters enforce specific syntax rules automatically during development.
